glsa.title: Pidgin: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Pidgin might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: Pidgin is a GTK Instant Messenger client for a variety of instant messaging protocols. libpurple is the core library for Pidgin.

description.p: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been found in the MXit protocol plug-in for libpurple.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Pidgin process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Pidgin users should upgrade to the latest version:
